name: Hotel Alpha-Palmiers

reviews.text: Excellent hotel vith very large rooms and a really good restaurant, with optimum staff in the hotel and in the restaurant.
reviews.title: Excellent Trip In Lausanne

reviews.text: When you are in Lausanne, one of the most beautiful towns in Switzerland, you can take a train to Martigny and from Martigny a little train named "Mont Blanc Express": you'll arrrived in Chamonix to see the near Mont Blanc, a wonderful wiew.
reviews.title: Perfect location, good value.

reviews.text: All this trip in only one day, A/R.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.text: Though the actual hotel was nice, the bathroom doors were perspex and so slightly see-through! The worst things was there was no lock on it and it did not shut properly. I was sharing a room with my parents so this wasn't really the best scenario. Ended up keeping a chair there to stop the door from opening every time there was a vibration in the room.
reviews.title: Not keen on the bathroom!

likes.liked: — see through doors that did not lock in the bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here with our party of 4 adults and 4 children for one night to break the train journey from Paris to Rome. The hotel is modern and the rooms are of a very high standard of cleanliness and fittings. It is well located to the train station (600 metres) but be prepared for a steep walk up the hill which can be tough if you are lugging bags. This is really a hotel for business travellers, they are not set up to deal with larger holiday groups. We had to hassle with the checkin person to get rooms together (so we could keep and eye on the kids) even though we had booked and payed 2 weeks before we arrived (and had requested this at the time of booking). After initially being told that they were fully booked and could not give us rooms on the same floor, after 15 (exhausting) minutes of hassling they somehow found that they could!
reviews.title: Modern hotel

reviews.text: I agree with other reviews of this hotel I checked out on TripAdvisor before booking this hotel - the whole place seems to be run by 6 people, actually I think it was 4!. They don't have enough staff to sufficiently look after the needs of holiday travellers but the rooms were impressive and very pleasant - once we got them!
reviews.title: Average hotel

reviews.text: Beautiful and modern hotel with a great lobby. Rooms very well decorated, spacious with great bathrooms. Good location.
reviews.title: Wonderful place, great location, easy access via train

likes.disliked: — The noise at night from street revelers.

reviews.text: I had to stay there one night because i was somehow locked out of my own place... The rate was ok for this type of hotel situated right in the middle of the city, a few minutes walk from the main station. The night person was nice and polite.
reviews.title: Good average hotel
Large beautiful rooms
reviews.text: I asked for a normal single room and was very surprised by the size of the bed. It is really a SINGLE bed, which is, according to me, very small for a hotel of this category. The view on the inside court is not bad, but you can actually see all the other rooms, so make sure you close your curtains at night.

reviews.title: Careful for parking
reviews.text: The bathroom as a bit strange at first since it doesn't consist of a separate room. It's a half open space on the room and, as said in other reviews, there is no curtains or anything for the water. But since you don't have to clean the room yourself, it doesn't matter.
All in all, it was a good and clean hotel but i would definitely try to get a special rate on the internet.
reviews.title: A good one

reviews.text: The hotel is very convienent to the train station, just a short trek up a steep hill to get to the hotel. Upon arrival we were assigned a room facing the street and located exactly across from the bar that releases loud patrons on into the street once it closes in the early am hours. So, we asked for a room away from the street and the rest of the trip was perfect. The staff was very kind and accomodating, they also lent us a converter for our electronics for the whole of our stay.
reviews.title: Amazing stay at the Alpha-Palmiers

likes.disliked: — The hill it is located on.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was very comfortable and I slept well everynight. The shower had excellent pressure but the toiletries were lacking. The glass door for the bathroom is a little strange but if you are staying alone or with your partner I don't think it would be an issue.
reviews.title: I hate to complain but.....

likes.liked: — The location - 400 yards from train station.

reviews.title: Poor quality, waste of money.
reviews.text: The breakfast, which was included, was magnificent! I dream of the breakfasts I had here. Everything was so delicious, cereal, yougurt, croissants with nutella, scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages. They had several different types of breads and spreads, along with cold cut meats and sliced cheeses.

reviews.title: Good Old Town choice
reviews.text: The location is nice, it's fairly easy to walk to shopping and down to the lake. The hill is the only downside to the location, it really is quite steep, otherwise the hotel was wonderful and I would certainly stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception staff were helpful and accommodating - we asked for an extra pillow and 20 coathangers. Within a few minutes, a receptionist arrived at our door, carrying a pillow and exactly 20 coathangers ! The good news ends right there.
reviews.title: maybe 4 stars in the 70's, 2-3 today

description: Modern Hotel with interior gardens, restaurant serving regional cuisine; set in the center of the city with views of the lake.
